Start multi task 2 times (open last app on some devices)
Can\'t open Administrator screen. Please open it manually from your device\'s settings or contact your manufacturer.
Place the button behind the keyboard
Thank you for buying the pro version.\10\10The left and right buttons, the screenshot action, the lock screen action, the quick settings action and the power menu action are unlocked!
Before sending me any email please be sure that your question or suggestion is not in the app\'s FAQ. If it has already been answered I won\'t respond to the email.
Please write your question or suggestion in English or French as I do not speak other languages.

To activate these functions : \10- Back \10- Quick settings \10- Power menu \10- Recent apps on some devices \10- Pull notifications on some devices \10\10Multi-Action Home button needs accessibility rights. \10Ones granted go back to the app.
Please enable accessibility for POWER MENU
Please enable accessibility for QUICK SETTINGS

This app uses Accessibility services.\10\10Accessibility services are used to start several actions (start multi-task, pull down notification panel, pull down quick settings, open power menu, simulate back). These actions can help people that need to use their phone with only one hand to start actions that are not easy to do with only one hand (for example pull down notifications). Accessibility services are only used to these actions.
Error : Please enable Draw over other apps permission.
Error : no Application found to send an email.
Error : no settings found to enable drawing on top.
Google Assistant not fount on your device.
Allow Multi-Action Home button to lock the device.

To activate the lock screen function, X Home Bar needs admin rights.
Ones granted go back to the app.

This app uses the Device Administrator permission.

The only administrator policy used is \"force-lock\" and it is used to lock the device when the user has done the selected action.
The app needs Draw on top permission
The app needs Draw on top permission. Please restart the app…
Can prevent the service from being killed by the system

Your physical home button is dead or broken ? This app can help you. It\'s very simple: The app create a software button in the center bottom of you screen and add several actions to this button. Actions you can do with the button : _Home _Recent apps _Back _Settings _Pull down notification panel _Start a selected app _[Pro version] take a screenshot _[Pro version] lock the screen _[Pro version] display quick settings _[Pro version] start power menu Pro version The pro version gives you more actions as well as other buttons to place on the right and left bottom corners of your screen. /! If your device has a navigation bar (Home, Back and Recent apps buttons) on the screen, the button will be above the navigation bar! /! This app uses the Device Administrator permission. The only administrator policy used is \"force-lock\" and it is used to lock the device when the user has done the selected action. Permission : _Read Phone State => Needed (and only used) to load applications list because of some manufacturers limitations. _Write Internal Storage => Save screenshots in the device. This app uses Accessibility services.\10\10Accessibility services are used to start several actions (start multi-task, pull down notification panel, pull down quick settings, open power menu, simulate back). These actions can help people that need to use their phone with only one hand to start actions that are not easy to do with only one hand (for example pull down notifications). Accessibility services are only used to these actions.
You already buy the pro version.\10\10The left and right buttons, the screenshot action and the lock screen action are unlocked
You need to update to pro version to unlock the right and left buttons
The pro version unlocks : \10\10- Right button \10- Left button \10- Lock screen action \10- Quick settings action \10- Power menu action\10- Screenshot action (only for Android > 5.0)
How much did you like this app ?
The app needs the \"Read phone state\" permission to load your applications list. \10\10(I know, \"phone state\" doesn\'t looks like \"applications list\" but this is the only way…)
Permission to record screen was denied…

In the next popup DO NOT CHECK \"Don\'t show again\" !\10\10There is a bug in Android that could make the screenshot function CRASH every time if you check this!\10\10 The only way to have this pop-up again if you check it is to uninstall and reinstall the app.
Touch the area at the bottom edge of the screen to launch an action
Set the vibration strength when pressing the action buttons.
Back action cannot be simulated on your Android version (Needs at least Jelly Bean 4.1)
